body.name: The Silent Duke's Dreamy Maid: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #26,080 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #190 in Historical Regency Fiction #379 in Victorian Historical Romance (Kindle Store) #553 in Regency Historical Romance

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Well written, full of love, romance, mystery, intrigue, secrets and twists. Evelyn is hiding a secret about who she is and what happened to her family. She finds a job working as a maid in the Duke's house. Sebastian is the Duke who tries to stay below society's sights, which doesn't always work. When home , he stumbles on Evelyn reading which surprises him. As they share parts of themselves , they also grow feelings for each other. Add in society and their rules and other issues into the melting pot , you get a goo reading story. They get their happily ever after. Would recommend to others.I am an ARC and leave this unbiased, honest review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet, clean romance
reviews.reviewText: Evelyn Sinclair works on the estate of Sebastian Sterling, the Duke of Ashbourne. Sebastian hadn't really paid much attention to her until he caught her reading a book and she quoted Plato. I was surprised that he wouldn't inquire further into her reading habits since she was a maid. The two strike up a friendship and, unbeknownst to each other, they start to fall in love. But there is a woman who is working hard to get Sebastian for herself and Evelyn has a secret the Duke doesn't know about.I liked getting to know the characters and seeing how the Duke's friend helps Evelyn out near the end. Nice ending and I enjoyed reading more in the extended epilogue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Evelyn and Sebastian
reviews.reviewText: This is a sweet, clean romance between a maid and a duke. As the duke chooses to live a quiet life away from the ton, he begins to seek out one of his maids, as he is attracted to her intelligence and independence, unaware she holds secrets. As their bond deepens, inferences and pressure come from his sister and the ton, that he needs to begin attending balls and procuring a wife. Secrets, drama, heartbreak and self-appraisals weaves throughout the story until the well deserved HEA. The author does a great job in creating detailed primary characters that the reader feels empathy for, and interest in knowing their outcome. And she created enough theatrics with the use of supporting characters that produced dilemmas between the couple. It’s a great read, with a few minor issues. The book needed another run through by an editor, as there were major word errors. And, I was somewhat disappointed by the extended epilogue as it left me with a few questions, versus a snug ending to the story. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Amanda Seabrook writes the bestest romance stories! She never leaves you hanging but leads you through til the end. Always a good read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not the same maid to married story
reviews.reviewText: I found the story clearly different early on but it was an interesting change putting 2 people together to talk about shared interests. The story was well written but I feel the frequency of reiterating her goals could have been less. I did like both of the main characters and looked forward to how they would finally find their ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Even though the plot was the typical 'Duke falls in love with a maid who really isn't a maid' I loved this book. It is very well written and the characters draw you into the story. You can sense the emotional turmoil in the characters trying to understand their feelings and circumstances. Definitely a good read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finding his love in a very learned maid
reviews.reviewText: Very enjoyable story, but often very frustrating. What a time period when one fallen from the "ton" can still find love befitting her birth. Great writing, but I wish I had skipped the addition. It seemed to weaken the beautiful story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It was good but…
reviews.reviewText: This was a lovely story between Sebastian and Evie. I like how their romance blossomed with every page. However, the only thing missing for me was more kisses. More intimate kisses between Sebastian and Evie to really seal their romance. It would have taken this story from 3 to 5 stars.Listen, I love a clean read but I hate how these authors are so scared or intimidated of incorporating kissing in their plots, and I don’t mean chaste kisses. Two people in genuine love with each other naturally kiss as a way to communicate their emotion and love for each other. Even the epilogue that I read, was devoid of passionate kisses which is crazy because Sebastian and Evie are married in the epilogue. This story has romance but the romance is lacking because it doesn’t have the heartfelt kisses that would complete it.Otherwise, this book was fairly good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What an amazing journey this couple went through with the other characters in this story of course they both had their fair share of villains

So different from the average romance story, this tale is not full of dramatic ups & downs to maintain it's reader's avid attention. The main characters seem to fall in love gradually & yet immediately, Evie is a maid (with a secret) that has been in Sebastian's employ for 5 years, but during that time, Sebastian has spent a lot 🐂 time travelling. It takes no time for them to discover their similar temperaments but their differences in rank make for a seemingly heart rendering break, I had to take reading breaks while my tears cleared, a few times!
